author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Note the package is not registered yet. I requested a review since it looks like a very small package (for now), and perhaps it may be possible to include in an existing package. At least, getting some eyes on it. Hope that's ok.
Ah sorry I misread that! Sure no problem.

I haven't looked closely but would this work just with ZygoteRules? If so, then perhaps it could be part of StructArrays? Would be nice to have always available. 

Edit: now I see `Zygote.accum` too.

I agree this is not a permanent solution. Probably Zygote should just be able to work this out (Zygote claims to be able to differentiate arbitrary Julia code). But it might take sometime before that is a reality.

In the meantime I chose a pretty descriptive title for this package so it doesn't collide with anything else, and I think it is safe to merge as it is even though in principle there should be a better solution in the future.

I think because of the comments that the auto-merge did not happen after the 3 days.
@ViralBShah can we merge this? Unless there are any objections @dhairyagandhi96 @MikeInnes ?
